title: Inverse Kinematics for Robotic Arms
description: Inverse Kinematics (IK) is a fundamental problem in robotics that involves determining the joint configurations of a robot arm that will achieve a desired position and orientation for its end-effector. While forward kinematics calculates the end-effector pose from known joint angles, IK solves the inverse: Given (x, y, z, roll, pitch, yaw) of end-effector, find (q1, q2, ..., qn) joint angles.
